reviews.text: We had a one night stay here while our friends camped nearby. We felt super smug when we arrived and saw our comfortable looking room and were offered a glass of wine or a beer while they were in a damp field putting their tents up in the rain! We stayed in the smaller double room, but there was still room for our 6 month old to sleep comfortably in the travel cot. When he was asleep, we made use of the guest living room and dug out a few board games. Breakfast was delicious and there was plenty of choice, especially for someone who isn't a fan of the full English. I'd highly recommend this if you're looking for someone to stay slightly out of Salisbury - it's great value.
reviews.title: Perfect, just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great B&B experience - everything that is best about staying in a guest house applies here. A warm welcome, charming house, lovely family, sumptuous breakfast, nice room with en suite, and very comfortable. Can't recommend Sarah's hospitality highly enough - she goes the extra mile to make you welcome and a fount of information about where to visit.
reviews.title: It's all true ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with our one night stay. Welcomed on arrival with a complimentary home made cake and an offer of drinks (including a glass of wine!). Décor throughout was elegant and much attention to detail had been thought through.
reviews.title: A warm welcome to Salisbury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was superb! The choice was original and all mouthwatering!! Delicious freshly baked muffins timed for when we chose to breakfast!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet location and is only a five minute drive into the picturesque city of Salisbury.
reviews.title: Fatastic B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Selected this because it was near enough to the city to walk (1.5 miles) or bus but not city centre - and was short walk from my best friend, who we were visiting at the same time. Everything I'd expect from an establishment with this ETB grading but personal touches - breakfast in a conservatory on one big table with other guests (if you get up at the same time!), freshly cooked breakfast with home-made muffins, friendly but not in your face owner. Could have booked dinner there (if you say so in advance) but there was also a pub in the village (Duck Inn) that did food as well as all the usual suspects in the city centre. Very comfortable room, spacious bathroom, shared a lounge area with other guests but also had full range of books, TV, DVD in our bedroom. Ideal for a winter city break and I'd like to come here again.
reviews.title: Smart but comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful little B&B; great food, hostess, decor, free parking, beautiful gardens, quaint church across the fence. A great central base if you have a car to visit Winchester, Bath, Stonehenge, Bristol, Cotswalds, Southhampton - all less than an hour away. This house is in the suburbs, a pub 3 blocks away but that's it; very quiet. If you don't have a car, the city centre is 2.4 miles away (cabbie clocked it). Cab is 6 GBP, bus is 2 GBP - the stop is right in front, but bus stops running at 18:00. Sarah is a super hostess!
reviews.title: Great little B&B

reviews.text: I travel alot on business and always try not to stay at motels or cold clinical chain hotels.
reviews.title: this is as good as it gets.

reviews.text: I had reason to visit Salisbury and researched bed and breakfast places on trip advisor and found this gem. Merivale House has many good write ups but words alone cannot do justice here. The welcome from Sarah's smile alone would melt the heart of the grumpiest traveller and then there are the cakes, scones, brownies or rocy road that are always freshly made. A tranquil study area with an eclectic library and music selection helps to relax before tatefully decorated rooms with soft comfortable beds and bed linen welcome you to a serene repose. All rooms have the essential tv dvd tea and coffee making thingsand more naughty treats. Breakfast is a delight and as varied as you like. Sarah holds nothing back in her effort for your comfort and pleasure and it will always be my first choice place to stay when visiting the region.
reviews.title: What an experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needing a room for one night, and with all my regular options filled due to a conference, we chanced upon Merivale. From now it will be my first option.
reviews.title: So good we stayed an extra night!
